Function Documentation

cparser_result_t cparser_abort_user_input ( cparser_t *  parser  ) 

Abort an outstanding user input.

This is used when a terminal cannot unechoed input.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
Returns:
CPARSER_OK if succeeded; CPARSER_ERR_NOT_EXIST if the parser is not expecting user input; CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS if the input parameter is invalid.

Definition at line 1070 of file cparser.c.

static int cparser_complete_one_level ( cparser_t *  parser  )  [static]

Complete one level in the parse tree.

There are serveral cases we will complete one level:

1. If in TOKEN state, the token is unique and complete. 2. If in WHITESPACE state, there is only one child and it is not a LF.

Definition at line 384 of file cparser.c.

static cparser_result_t cparser_execute_cmd ( cparser_t *  parser  )  [static]

If the command is not complete, attempt to complete the command.

If there is a complete comamnd, execute the glue (& action) function of a command.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
Returns:
CPARSER_OK if a valid command is executed; CPARSER_NOT_OK otherwise.

cparser_result_t cparser_help_cmd ( cparser_t *  parser,
char *  str 
)

Walk the parser tree and generate a list of all available commands.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
str Pointer to a filter string. If it is NULL, all commands in the parse tree are displayed. Otherwise, only commands with keywords that contain 'str' as a substring are displayed.
Returns:
CPARSER_OK if succeeded; CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS if the parser structure is invalid.

Definition at line 990 of file cparser.c.

static cparser_result_t cparser_help_post_walker ( cparser_t *  parser,
cparser_node_t *  node,
void *  cookie 
) [static]

Post-order walker function used by cparser_help_cmd().

Its main function is to print out a command description and to pop the help stack.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
node Pointer to the current parse tree node.
cookie Pointer to the help stack.
Returns:
Return CPARSER_OK always.

Definition at line 910 of file cparser.c.

static cparser_result_t cparser_help_pre_walker ( cparser_t *  parser,
cparser_node_t *  node,
void *  cookie 
) [static]

Pre-order walker function used by cparser_help_cmd().

Its main function is to push into the help stack when recurse into the next level.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
node Pointer to the current parse tree node.
cookie Pointer to the help stack.
Returns:
Return CPARSER_OK always.

Definition at line 887 of file cparser.c.

static void cparser_help_print_node ( cparser_t *  parser,
cparser_node_t *  node,
const int  add_lf,
const int  print_desc 
) [static]

Print the description of a node out.

For keyword nodes, the keyword itself is printed. For parameter nodes, a string of the form <[type]:[parameter]> is printed. For end nodes, <LF> is printed. This call should never be invoked with a root node.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
node Pointer to the node to be printed.
add_lf 1 to add LF before printing the node; 0 otherwise.
print_desc 1 to print the description of the node; 0 otherwise.

char **  cmd,
cparser_result_t *  rc,
int *  is_priv 
)

Get information about the last executed command.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
Return values:
cmd Pointer to the command string.
rc The result code.
is_priv 1 if the command is privileged; 0 otherwise. Only meaningful if the command is valid.

Definition at line 1092 of file cparser.c.

cparser_result_t cparser_load_cmd ( cparser_t *  parser,
char *  filename 
)

Load a command/config file to the parser.

A command/config file is just a text file with CLI commands. (One command per line.) The only difference is that submode is automatically exited if the indentation changes. This behavior is the same as Cisco CLI.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
filename Pointer to the filename.
Returns:
CPARSER_OK if succeeded; CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS if the input parameters are NULL; CPARSER_NOT_OK if the file cannot be opened.

Definition at line 744 of file cparser.c.

void cparser_print_prompt ( const cparser_t *  parser  ) 

Print the CLI prompt.

If in privileged mode, prepend a '+'.

Parameters:

Definition at line 45 of file cparser.c.

cparser_result_t cparser_quit ( cparser_t *  parser  ) 

Exit a parser session.

This call causes the parser to exit and returns from cparser_run().

Parameters:
parser - Pointer to the parser structure.
Returns:
CPARSER_OK if succeeded; CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS if failed.

Definition at line 698 of file cparser.c.

cparser_result_t cparser_run ( cparser_t *  parser  ) 

Run the parser.

This function is a wrapper around cparser_input(). It first calls cparser_io_init(). Then, it calls cparser_getch() and feeds character into the parser until it quits.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
Returns:
CPARSER_OK if succeeded; CPARSER_NOT_OK if failed.

Definition at line 637 of file cparser.c.

)

enable 1 to enable privileged mode; 0 to disable.

cparser_result_t cparser_submode_enter ( cparser_t *  parser,
void *  cookie,
char *  prompt 
)

Enter a submode.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
cookie A parameter that is passed back to each submode command via cparser_context_t.
prompt The new submode prompt.
Returns:
CPARSER_OK if succeeded; CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS if the input parameters are invalid; CPARSER_NOT_OK if there too many levels of submode already.

Definition at line 708 of file cparser.c.

cparser_result_t cparser_submode_exit ( cparser_t *  parser  ) 

Leave a submode.

The previous mode context and prompt are automatically restored.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
Returns:
CPARSER_OK if succeeded; CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS if the input parameters are invalid; CPARSER_NOT_OK if the parser has not entered any submode.

Definition at line 731 of file cparser.c.

cparser_result_t cparser_user_input ( cparser_t *  parser,
const char *  prompt,
int  echoed,
char *  buf,
int  buf_size,
cparser_input_cb  cb 
)

Read a raw string from the user via the terminal.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
prompt Pointer to a prompt string. If NULL, nothing is printed.
echoed 1 to echo the input; 0 otherwise.
buf Pointer to the buffer for user input.
buf_size Size of the user input buffer.
cb Callback function that is called when input is complete.
Returns:
CPARSER_OK if succeeded; CPARSER_ERR_INVALID_PARAMS if the input parameters are invalid.

Definition at line 1041 of file cparser.c.

cparser_result_t cparser_walk ( cparser_t *  parser,
cparser_walker_fn  pre_fn,
cparser_walker_fn  post_fn,
void *  cookie 
)

Walk the parse tree in the parser.

Parameters:
parser Pointer to the parser structure.
pre_fn Walker function that called before tranverse its children.
post_fn Walker function that called after transvere its children.
cookie An opaque pointer that is passed back to the caller via callback functions 'pre_fn' and 'post_fn'.
Returns:
CPARSER_OK if succeeded; CPARSER_NOT_OK if failed.
